task.title: Washing Clothes in Stackable Laundry Machines
task.shortdesc: Instructions for using stackable laundry machines commonly found in shared housing facilities.

prereq.p: Bring your own laundry detergent, fabric softener, bleach, and any other cleaning agents you need.

context.p: Stackable laundry machines are commonly found in shared housing facilities. These instructions guide you through the process of drying clothes effectively.

step.cmd: Transfer the washed clothes from the washing machine to the dryer drum, located on top of the stackable unit.

choices.choice: Add dryer sheets or wool dryer balls to reduce static and add softness (optional).

step.cmd: Select the appropriate drying settings on the dryer control panel, usually located above the dryer door.
step.info: Use a lower heat setting for delicate or synthetic fabrics to prevent damage.

step.cmd: Press the start button to begin the drying cycle.

postreq.p: Set a personal timer to keep track of the remaining wash and dry time.
